Encode HTML characters for safe embedding in micromark.

## Summary

This package provides a utility function for encoding potentially dangerous HTML characters in text.  This is essential for preventing cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities when embedding user-provided content in HTML.  It's specifically designed to be used within micromark extensions.

## Installation

This package is ESM only.

**Node.js (version 16+)**

```bash
npm install micromark-util-encode
```

**Deno (with esm.sh)**

```typescript
import { encode } from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-encode@latest';
```

**Browsers (with esm.sh)**

```html
<script type="module">
  import { encode } from 'https://esm.sh/micromark-util-encode@latest?bundle';
</script>
```

## Usage

```typescript
import { encode } from 'micromark-util-encode';

const unsafeString = '<script>alert("XSS!")</script>';
const encodedString = encode(unsafeString);
console.log(encodedString); // Output: &lt;script&gt;alert("XSS!")&lt;/script&gt;
```

## API

### `encode(value)`

Encodes the given string, replacing potentially harmful HTML characters with their corresponding HTML entity equivalents.

**Parameters:**

*   `value` (string): The string to encode.

**Returns:**

Encoded string (string).

## Compatibility

This package is compatible with micromark@^3 and Node.js v16+.  See the [CHANGELOG](CHANGELOG.md) for details on compatibility with specific versions.

## Security

This package is designed to enhance security. Always encode user-supplied data before embedding it in HTML to mitigate XSS vulnerabilities.  Consult the [`security.md`](security.md) for details on security best practices.

## Contributing

See the [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) file for guidelines on contributing.
